results.title: Tanzania: of people and a vision
results.creator_credit: Donald J. Casey and Carousel Films
results.brief_description: In 1961, freedom bells rang for independence for the Tanzanian people and the country faced great developmental problems. President Nyerere sought to unite the people to work together as a nation. With government approval, Mary Knoll Missioners established an experimental village project that became a model for a new, communal lifestyle. Whereas in the past isolation was the common denominator, the people are now experiencing their first glimpse of “ujamaa”, African socialism or familyhood. Together, husbands and wives study agriculture, nutrition, animal husbandry, baby care; families help each other manufacture bricks and build homes.

results.title: Tanjong Karang: Malaya
results.brief_description: In 1951 Malaya could only produce sufficient rice to supply half the needs of her population. At the Tanjong Karang Irrigation Scheme, swamp land is being reclaimed and put under rice cultivation.

results.title: Tangramation
results.creator_credit: Alister MacGregor, John Bird and Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School
results.brief_description: Tangra is an ancient game from China; a square is divided into seven pieces from which an amazing range of figures and shapes can be constructed, from a house to a horse, from a bird to a boat. This short film explores some of the possibilities of this fascinating activity.

results.title: Tanglewood Music School and Music Festival
results.creator_credit: MPO Productions and United States Information Service
results.brief_description: A record of the pioneering work being done by Serge Koussevitsky in establishing the music festival and summer school held each year at Berkshire, USA. With the assistance of the Boston Symphony Orchestra, such composers as Leonard Bernstein and Aaron Copland help and stimulate young students of composition in their work. The film concludes with a premier performance of “The Last words of David” by Randall Thompson.

results.title: Tangerine dream
results.creator_credit: Keri Light and Victorian College of the Arts, School of Film and Television
results.brief_description: A pharmaceutical misadventure which takes place in a rainbow laundromat ends with Bonnie (Tania Lacy), and Simon (Ben Mendelsohn) speaking in visionary gibberish as they flash Bonnie’s laundry. They inhabit an indefinable world, between midnight and dawn, within the murky depths of paranoia and ambition.

results.title: Tangents
results.brief_description: Explains that in problems involving right-angled triangles a choice exists between using sine or cosine in the solution. Discusses the use of tangents as a simpler function for solving some problems.

results.title: Tanganyika: new nation
results.creator_credit: British Information Services and British Pathe News
results.brief_description: A record of HRH Prince Philip’s visit to Tanganyika during the Independence celebrations. After arrival in the capital city, Dar es Salaam, the Duke, with the then Prime Minister, Julius Nyerere, is seen attending several events to mark the occasion, including a tattoo and display, the Independence Day Ceremonial, a reception at Government House, and the State Opening of the Tanganyika Parliament.

results.title: Tamu - the guest
results.creator_credit: Ian Stocks, Jane Oehr and Australian Broadcasting Commission
results.brief_description: A docudrama about the island of Bali as observed by the Australian painter, Donald Friend, who has lived there for six years. Examines the influences of the environment and local art forms on Friend’s work, and the way he interacts with local Balinese society.
